blocks.name: Buttons
blocks.description: The default .us-btn button. There is a larger version of the button as well. Each of these styles adheres to the uSwitch branding colours. Currently we support anchor tags and button tags as the main ussage

markup.example: Link Button
Link Button
Link Button

state.name: .us-btn--hero
state.description: Navy outline used for buttons on `$c-cyan` hero's

markup.example: Link Button
Link Button

state.name: .us-btn--arrowed, .us-btn--arrowed-right
state.description: Arrowed button used for CTAs (right pointing)

markup.example: Link Button

state.name: .us-btn--arrowed-left
state.description: Left pointing variation of arrowed buttons

markup.example: Link Button
Link Button

state.name: .disabled
state.description: Disabled styling (can also be styled with :disabled)

markup.example: Link Button
Link Button

blocks.name: Content group
blocks.description: The .us-content-group is a separator element for content groupings. Ideal to split up landing pages with reasonable padding

state.name: .mobile-bordered
state.description: Adds a smaller border and padding to mobile devices. By default there is none

markup.example:
Swat at dog intrigued by the shower missing until dinner time and run in circles use lap as chair.

Swat at dog stretch and stand in front of the computer screen.

Swat at dog intrigued by the shower missing until dinner time and run in circles use lap as chair.

Swat at dog stretch and stand in front of the computer screen.

blocks.name: Guide article
blocks.description: This is the default guide item for uSwitch landing page. It extends the news item heavily. The description is initially hidden and shown on hover or any desktop devices

markup.example:
Car insurance guides

Read our car insurance advice guides for the facts on why you need car insurance, the types of cover available, and tips on how to make a claim.

Read more

blocks.name: Hero
blocks.description: The .us-hero is used for the upper part of most pages. The hero can also be used mid-page to highlight other sections. We define it with .us-hero

markup.example:
Hero title

Swat at dog intrigued by the shower missing until dinner time.

blocks.name: Anchor links
blocks.description: Anchor tag styling, with and without a border

state.name: .us-link
state.description: Adds a border bottom to the link

markup.example: Link
Link

blocks.name: Custom tick/numbered lists
blocks.description: A simple way of quickly styling up <ul> or <ol> with ticks or custom numbers - .us-ticked-list or .us-numbered-list, with options for a white or hero-blue background (by wrapping in .us-hero or .us-custom-list-alt)

blocks.name: Default anchored lists
blocks.description: The default .us-list list styling for any components with anchors in them. Used primarily to direct users to additional pages.

markup.example:
• List item 1
  • List item 2
  • List item 3

blocks.name: Loader
blocks.description: It shows when added the class .us-loader--loading and it can center itself on the parent container if you add .us-loader--centered

markup.example: Loading deals

blocks.name: News article item
blocks.description: The news item article standard. Built with .us-news-item. The news item image is a background image as the problem of not displaying <img> tags on mobile hasn't been resolved.

markup.example:
Consumer rights 14 Nov 2014

Customer uses promoted tweet to complain about BA

Sign of things to come? Social media helps to empower disgruntled consumer amid lost luggage row

More consumer rights

state.name: .us-field-required
state.description: Any required form field has this class to show an asterisk beside the label

blocks.name: Inputs with backgrounds
blocks.description: In addition to our basic inputs we've got some useful input backgrounds that are used across the site. Each input background is a base64 encoded (for IE9 purposes) SVG to allow scalability on retina devices. Any browser not supporting SVG has a PNG fallback.

state.name: .postcode
state.description: Used for form fields asking for a postcode (typically in hero's)

markup.example: <input class='us-form-input postcode' type='text'>
<input class='us-form-input email' type='text'>

state.name: .phone
state.description: Used when asking for a phone number

markup.example: <input class='us-form-input phone' type='text'>

state.name: .pound
state.description: Used when asking for cost of something

markup.example: <input class='us-form-input pound' type='text'>
<input class='us-form-input password' type='text'>
<input class='us-form-input kwh' type='text'>
<input class='us-form-input {$modifiers}' type='text'>

blocks.name: Inputs
blocks.description: The standard form input, .us-form-input, styled with our brand colours. Explicitly classed to allow individual app styling for other inputs

markup.example: <input class='us-form-input large' type='text'>
<input class='us-form-input {$modifiers}' type='text'>

blocks.name: Radio buttons and checkboxes
blocks.description: Our standard radio and checkbox styling. Webkit/Blink browsers display our font icon tick or a box shadow circle. Other browsers fallback to default styling.

blocks.name: Selects
blocks.description: The .us-form-select is built with inline background-image SVGs for Webkit/Blink browsers that allow for Sass variable changes on the hover/normal colours. Firefox allows for .us-form-select wrap to be added on top of the select to replicate styling, whilst other browser fallback to native implementation. $select-base-color, $select-hover-color and $select-active-color allow for different colouring of the border/dropdown.

blocks.name: Form validation
blocks.description: Validation message and input styling provides a consistent look and feel to uStyle forms.

state.name: .us-validation--bordered
state.description: use this for any singular field validation or validation on backgrounds

markup.example: Validation message here
Validation message here

state.name: .us-validation--error
state.description: Error styling (default) for incorrect data on forms

markup.example: Validation message here
Validation message here
